comment: Hashimoto Sensee was the best. She was easy going and accommodating. If you had trouble or needed extra support, she would highly recommend tutoring with the World Languages and Cultures office. I had a strong interest for Japanese and she didn't stop me from that. She was motivational.

Hashimoto Sensei was a great teacher however her teaching style didn't mesh very well with me. Great for beginners at a 1001 level. The textbook is super important for this class and onward so I recommend buying it.

had her for 1001/1002/2001, amazing teacher who just wants you to do your part in learning. Participate in class, do your homework, and prepare for quizzes and you will pass in flying colors. Very passionate and caring and will answer any question while keeping classes fun. do your part and she will take care of you

I took Hashimoto Sensei for both 1001 and 1002. You can tell she loves her students and is always available for help. The class is a lot of studying, quizzes, and homework but it helps you for the tests in the end. The textbook is the same for both 1001 and 1002 and the class is organized into chapters of the textbook.

If you loved 1001 you will love 1002 for all of the same reasons. Again Hashimoto-Sensei has a way of teaching the material that is fun, and she encourages students to do better than they did last semester. I found that most students did better at the end of 1002 compared to 1001. She is just wonderful and makes learning Japanese a blast.

Hashimoto sensei is a great professor. Japanese is a difficult language but she makes it fun! I had a challenging semester due to unforeseen circumstances in my life but she made sure to check on me and help me keep up in the class. Be prepared to study a lot as there are a lot of quizzes. Class participation is 10% of your grade.

I had her for 1001 and 1002, obvi japanese is very hard but she made it as easy as possible, she made sure to review at the beginning of every class. had homework after each class but it helped me process what I had just learned. use the quizlets she has and make sure to participate as it is a grade!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Attendance matters, she does a lot more talking then teaching. Boring class rude teacher.

I loved this class! Hashimoto sensee's strength is that she ENGAGES the students in a fun way, and it makes Japanese easy! If you're diligent you'll have an easier time than you expect! 

There is a lot of homework. 

Note that the way her class is structured is rather rigid. If you like exploring languages your own way, that will be tough here.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Class has A LOT of memorization, and a quiz almost every or every other class, which can either badly hurt or help your grades. Hashimoto sensei is very nice, caring, and passionate, but the coarse itself is just tough. PS: She has "daily participation point" where you have to speak out loud in every class at least once. PARTICIPATION MATTERS!!!

Love her, she is very funny, easy-going, and personable. Her powerpoints for classes are engaging and contain a lot of information. You have to come to class and participate, but she makes it fun. Did not have a single boring class the whole semester. You can also always email her random questions about the Japanese language or culture.

Hashimoto Sensee is great! A super fun and passionate teacher that I always looked forward to seeing. There are small quizzes almost every class but they are all fairly easy and she does a great job at teaching you the material. Her powerpoints are themed and super fun. Grades very promptly and is very helpful to struggling students.

Hashimoto Sensei is an amazing Japanese Teacher. She was my teacher for my first ever Japanese class and it was a great experience. Homework is due the day after classes and there are usually quizzes every class. As long as you do the homework and participate in class it will be a very enjoyable experience. Would 100% take Hashimoto Sensei's class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hashimoto-sensei was a great teacher despite the pandemic and the challenges that brought. Her class was interesting as well as informative. She makes learning Japanese a lot easier than it could be otherwise (trust me, I've tried.) Absolutely recommend her class.

Took it online and attendance and participation were mandatory. She made class so fun and her powerpoints were so cute! Shes very understanding and caring. Tests are not bad at all, and homework was easy if you paid attention. She does make you work in groups and talk in the class call. Overall amazing! I wish i took the second class!! Love her!

Hashimoto-sensei is easily the best teacher I've ever had. I joined her class late, but it was absolutely the best move I've ever made - her class is fun and I absolutely loved it. If you pay attention and be prepared to make mistakes in class, you'll learn easily.

Considering this was my introduction to Japanese, Hashimoto sensei was a great teacher on all fronts. She's very good at teaching the material, very good personality. I can't imagine someone coming to class and not liking her as a teacher. She makes it very easy to understand and while there is some class participation, it's easy and forgiving.

Hashimoto-Sensei is an amazing Professor! Her class is so fun and engaging! There are quite a bit of Homework assignments but they are very, very easy and pretty much free 100's. She has very engaging lectures very are mandatory to show up and participate in but, its for the best that you do because they definitely help you to learn very well!

Hashimoto Sensei was amazing! She was funny and her lectures were fun, but you do have to participate in them and you have to keep your camera on. Theres homework due twice a week and theres 3 tests, but theyre easy. Take her!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the best professors Ive ever had. She mad learning Japanese extremely fun! She is also very funny

Greatest teacher I've ever had. She is super energetic and makes every class the best part of my day. She is also very easy to talk to and will always walk out with you if you wait. I admit that my friends and I have had conversations with her that have lasted an hour after class!
Pretty funny and entertaining, pay attention in class and you'll be okay.

Amazing teacher and very enjoyable class! I loved learning Japanese from Hashimoto Sensei. She has a great sense of humor and her lectures were easy to understand. She cares about your grade and understanding of the language ,and is very helpful. I always looked forward to her class; I would definitely recommend her.
